docs.snippet: A day after American officials said Turkey had agreed to allow the use of its air bases for operations against the Islamic State, Turkish officials said talks were still underway.
docs.lead_paragraph: A day after American officials said Turkey had agreed to allow the use of its air bases for operations against the Islamic State, Turkish officials said talks were still underway.
docs.abstract: Turkish officials say there is no deal with United States to allow its air bases to be used for operations against Islamic State, one day after US officials announce deal; Turkish comments represent another miscommunication between US and Turkey.

docs.snippet: Turkey is caught between conflicting interests: defeating Islamic militants across its border with Syria while not strengthening Kurdish separatists inside Turkey.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey is caught between conflicting interests: defeating Islamic militants across its border with Syria while not strengthening Kurdish separatists inside Turkey.
docs.abstract: Chaos on Turkey's border with Syria and Turkey's ambivalent reaction to fighting between Kurds and Islamic State group are reflection of nation's complex role in Syrian civil war; Turkey does not wish to enhance power of its own Turkish separatists, even though it would benefit from defeating Islamic State militants.

docs.abstract: Turkish Foreign Minister Ahmet Davutoglu is chosen by the ruling Justice and Development Party to succeed President-elect Recep Tayyip Erdogan as prime minister and party chairman; his nomination will go to vote at party congress, where it is expected to go unchallenged.

docs.lead_paragraph: Creating a no-fly zone and stepping up combat air patrols would open a direct conflict with Syria, going beyond the U.S. mission against the Islamic State.
docs.abstract: Turkey, with United States continuing to pressure it to do more in fight against Islamic State, is hardening around idea of creating buffer zone along its frontier with Syria; American military planners are said to be looking at how to implement such a plan, which would require no-fly zone and stepped up combat patrols to take out Syrian air defense systems.

docs.snippet: As fighters with ISIS bore down Tuesday on the Turkish border, President Obama’s plan to fight the militant group without being drawn deeper into the Syrian civil war was coming under acute strain.
docs.lead_paragraph: As fighters with ISIS bore down Tuesday on the Turkish border, President Obama’s plan to fight the militant group without being drawn deeper into the Syrian civil war was coming under acute strain.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama's plan to fight Islamic State group without being drawn deeper into Syrian civil war comes under acute strain as militant fighters bear down on Syrian town of Kobani on Turkish border; Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan says country will not get more deeply involved in conflict unless United States agrees to give great support to Syrian rebels.
